CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1946, pg. 2, reads: "GOOD LUCK, FATHER - Edith Moore, one of the thirteen Negro employes [employees or employed] at the local offices of the OPA [Office of Price Administration], wishes Father Charles Owen Rice the 'best of everything' as Father drops in for a chat at the offices of which he was former director. Others in photo are (in the usual order): John Resemond, private secretary; Walter Pettey, rent examiner, and the new director, C. Howard McPeak.  Mr. McPeak promises to continue the same unbiased attitude toward all applicants and all employes [sic] which characterized the administration of Father Rice who headed the OPA since 1942. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left: John Resemond, Father Charles Owen Rice shaking hands with Edith Moore, Walter Pettey in center, and C. Howard McPeak, in Office of Price Administration
